00032 /*
00033  * Machine dependent MSP430X UART0 code.
00034  */
00035 
00036 #include <stdlib.h>
00037 
00038 #include "contiki.h"
00039 #ifdef __IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__
00040 #include <msp430.h>
00041 #else
00042 #include <io.h>
00043 #include <signal.h>
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 #include "sys/energest.h"
00047 #include "dev/uart0.h"
00048 #include "dev/watchdog.h"
00049 #include "lib/ringbuf.h"
00050 #include "dev/leds.h"
00051 
00052 static int (*uart0_input_handler)(unsigned char c);
00053 
00054 static volatile uint8_t transmitting;
00055 
00056 #ifdef UART0_CONF_TX_WITH_INTERRUPT
00057 #define TX_WITH_INTERRUPT UART0_CONF_TX_WITH_INTERRUPT
00058 #else /* UART0_CONF_TX_WITH_INTERRUPT */
00059 #define TX_WITH_INTERRUPT 1
00060 #endif /* UART0_CONF_TX_WITH_INTERRUPT */
00061 
00062 
00063 #if TX_WITH_INTERRUPT
00064 #define TXBUFSIZE 64
00065 
00066 static struct ringbuf txbuf;
00067 static uint8_t txbuf_data[TXBUFSIZE];
00068 #endif /* TX_WITH_INTERRUPT */
00069 
00070 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00071 uint8_t
00072 uart0_active(void)
00073 {
00074   return (UCA0STAT & UCBUSY) | transmitting;
00075 }
00076 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00077 void
00078 uart0_set_input(int (*input)(unsigned char c))
00079 {
00080   uart0_input_handler = input;
00081 }
00082 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00083 void
00084 uart0_writeb(unsigned char c)
00085 {
00086   watchdog_periodic();
00087 #if TX_WITH_INTERRUPT
00088   /* Put the outgoing byte on the transmission buffer. If the buffer
00089      is full, we just keep on trying to put the byte into the buffer
00090      until it is possible to put it there. */
00091   while(ringbuf_put(&txbuf, c) == 0);
00092 
00093   /* If there is no transmission going, we need to start it by putting
00094      the first byte into the UART. */
00095   if(transmitting == 0) {
00096     transmitting = 1;
00097     UCA0TXBUF = ringbuf_get(&txbuf);
00098   }
00099 
00100 #else /* TX_WITH_INTERRUPT */
00101 
00102   /* Loop until the transmission buffer is available. */
00103   /*Enric while((IFG2 & UCA0TXIFG) == 0); */
00104   while((UCA0STAT & UCBUSY));
00105 
00106   /* Transmit the data. */
00107   UCA0TXBUF = c;
00108 #endif /* TX_WITH_INTERRUPT */
00109 }
00110 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00111 #if ! WITH_UIP /* If WITH_UIP is defined, putchar() is defined by the SLIP driver */
00112 #endif /* ! WITH_UIP */
00113 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00114 /**
00115  * Initalize the RS232 port.
00116  *
00117  */
00118 void
00119 uart0_init(unsigned long ubr)
00120 {
00121   /* RS232 */
00122   UCA0CTL1 |= UCSWRST;            /* Hold peripheral in reset state */
00123   UCA0CTL1 |= UCSSEL_2;           /* CLK = SMCLK */
00124 
00125   UCA0BR0 = 0x45;                 /* 8MHz/115200 = 69 = 0x45 */
00126   UCA0BR1 = 0x00;
00127   UCA0MCTL = UCBRS_3;             /* Modulation UCBRSx = 3 */
00128 
00129   P3DIR &= ~0x20;                 /* P3.5 = USCI_A0 RXD as input */
00130   P3DIR |= 0x10;                  /* P3.4 = USCI_A0 TXD as output */
00131   P3SEL |= 0x30;                  /* P3.4,5 = USCI_A0 TXD/RXD */
00132   /*UCA0CTL1 &= ~UCSWRST;*/       /* Initialize USCI state machine */
00133 
00134   transmitting = 0;
00135 
00136   /* XXX Clear pending interrupts before enable */
00137   IFG2 &= ~UCA0RXIFG;
00138   IFG2 &= ~UCA0TXIFG;
00139   UCA0CTL1 &= ~UCSWRST;                   /* Initialize USCI state machine **before** enabling interrupts */
00140   IE2 |= UCA0RXIE;                        /* Enable UCA0 RX interrupt */
00141   /* Enable USCI_A0 TX interrupts (if TX_WITH_INTERRUPT enabled) */
00142 #if TX_WITH_INTERRUPT
00143   ringbuf_init(&txbuf, txbuf_data, sizeof(txbuf_data));
00144   IE2 |= UCA0TXIE;                        /* Enable UCA0 TX interrupt */
00145 #endif /* TX_WITH_INTERRUPT */
00146 }
00147 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00148 
00149 #ifdef __IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__
00150 #pragma vector=USCIAB0RX_VECTOR
00151 __interrupt void
00152 #else
00153 interrupt(USCIAB0RX_VECTOR)
00154 #endif
00155 uart0_rx_interrupt(void)
00156 {
00157   uint8_t c;
00158 
00159   ENERGEST_ON(ENERGEST_TYPE_IRQ);
00160   leds_toggle(LEDS_RED);
00161   if(UCA0STAT & UCRXERR) {
00162     c = UCA0RXBUF;   /* Clear error flags by forcing a dummy read. */
00163   } else {
00164     c = UCA0RXBUF;
00165     if(uart0_input_handler != NULL) {
00166       if(uart0_input_handler(c)) {
00167         LPM4_EXIT;
00168       }
00169     }
00170   }
00171   ENERGEST_OFF(ENERGEST_TYPE_IRQ);
00172 }
00173 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00174 #if TX_WITH_INTERRUPT
00175 #ifdef __IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__
00176 #pragma vector=USCIAB0TX_VECTOR
00177 __interrupt void
00178 #else
00179 interrupt(USCIAB0TX_VECTOR)
00180 #endif
00181 uart0_tx_interrupt(void)
00182 {
00183   ENERGEST_ON(ENERGEST_TYPE_IRQ);
00184   if((IFG2 & UCA0TXIFG)){
00185 
00186     if(ringbuf_elements(&txbuf) == 0) {
00187       transmitting = 0;
00188     } else {
00189       UCA0TXBUF = ringbuf_get(&txbuf);
00190     }
00191   }
00192 
00193   /* In a stand-alone app won't work without this. Is the UG misleading? */
00194   IFG2 &= ~UCA0TXIFG;
00195 
00196   ENERGEST_OFF(ENERGEST_TYPE_IRQ);
00197 }
00198 #endif /* TX_WITH_INTERRUPT */
00199 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
